title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to Export Control Regulations
summary: The document is a presidential notice from August 4, 2025, announcing the continuation of the national emergency related to export control regulations. The emergency was initially declared on August 17, 2001, under Executive Order 13222, citing threats to national security, foreign policy, and the economy due to the expiration of the Export Administration Act of 1979. The notice explains that the emergency must continue to implement certain sanctions authorized by the Export Administration Act and the Export Control Reform Act of 2018. Therefore, the President is extending the national emergency for another year, in accordance with the National Emergencies Act. The notice will be published in the Federal Register and transmitted to Congress.
